GUIM6Oq_CX5xPm38K39WTA.text: Surprise.  Surprise. This little place was amazing. Pizza was unique and delicious. My kid is still talking about his bacon dog.  Truly enjoyed my falafel sandwich. Quick, friendly service. All for under $25

XrRjWPVuhaBeDu8oz90C_Q.text: Such a great little place....excellent food and the owners, workers are awesome! They really take time to answer any questions and go out of their way to accommodate. I took their recommendation and had their "best seller" which was a chicken wrap with deliciously chosen extras. Will be back. Want to try everything!

x9Zn1nCGUdLjEFY-LFgIjw.text: Awesome sandwich and the torts were a great change of pace. I am only here for the week but will go back!

O1UvB8Q84Ey9QFollcsQIw.text: For a Burger and Pizza joint, the food is pretty damn good. The seating is small but really cool. So if your coming on a weekend. Probably gonna wait for a table. The staff is really nice. And did I mention the food is really good!

photos.caption: Photo of Brick N' Mortar Kitchen & Catering - Heidelberg, PA, United States. The lights inn here are really cool

k34seXdMDHb3Yhqfr9Kz1Q.text: AbSoLuTeLy some of the best food I have eaten. My whole family enjoyed the food. The critical husband, the barely eater tween and the picky child. A hidden gem! I live almost 2 hours away and looked through Yelp for advise! Definitely a 5+ star rating from food to service. Nice, kind people who put love in the food they make. Only wish I could rate them on TripAdvisor as well. If you are near this place, you must EAT HERE! You won't be disappointed at all. Now the only thing is I recommend that it gets featured on Guy Fieri show.

snLXXlb_NDCz88Rr1rN8fQ.text: Amazing food. Everything seems well thought out, the chef must have an excellent pallet. Great friendly service.

Kn_YF4-v6B69e0yxHS9qwA.text: WOW! Fantastic little joint with amazingly delicious food. I wish it was bigger inside bcs once people find out about this hidden gem - it's gonna be jammed packed. Give it a try before the secret gets out and you can't get a table & are forced to just takeout!

jSLwU1l5ph8wWjYnkGLQQA.text: Insanely delicious!  What a surprise this little gem is.  Can't wait to go back.  The mushroom soup is unique and delish.

0GEfP7eLIhVUD6hpWGKuBA.text: This place is a little gem ! Have done takeout before for a quick dinner and it is always fabulous . Had them cater a birthday party for me and everyone absolutely loved the food . Some of my favorites are the Flankstein, buffalo soldier salad and falafel sliders- the quality of the meats and ingredients is excellent and very reasonably priced , staff could not be nicer! Definitely worth checking out !

cVzL6TRsFZ3UyP6mxy0GZw.text: Had the "Flyin' Hawaiian" for lunch.  The burger was cooked perfectly and the creation of Ham, Pineapple, and aioli put a stop to our lunch conversation.  We were both very happy with the food and hope to be back again.    Between creation and exicusion you won't be disappointed with the burgers.    The only down side is that it is small and hard to find a seat at an actual table.  Another diamond in the rough...

0G6JFmbnebZApHVdCRBoYg.text: Very creative menu. Not typical sub/pizza joint. I'm normally not a review writer, but felt like this place deserves the recognition. My wife loves the salads and the house made dressings. Just had the Flankenstein pita wrap. Great steak, marinated perfectly, horseradish dressing was dynamite and the veggies couldn't have been fresher. This is our new go to spot. Great job BNM people!

F3K3T12LSC0nzrk19BTAZQ.text: Great must-try place in the Carnegie-Heidelberg area. Creative menu and the food was fantastic. We will definitely be repeat customers.

vIMog1sUio2GY8yWC6uJXA.text: Whether in the area on purpose or by mistake a good place to get some good food. Seating is limited but good was good.

puSL8h75C8fi9aLVkr48TQ.text: I ask what the best selling item was, Rastafarian sandwich. It was excellent, great flavor perfect size.

3oiUzJYI_Br-l1dP_OOpUw.text: The food is fantastic and the people that work there are the best ppl in town! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu and I am in love with their torts!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Brick N' Mortar Kitchen & Catering - Heidelberg, PA, United States. Loaded torts with braised pork shoulder
Photo of Brick N' Mortar Kitchen & Catering - Heidelberg, PA, United States. Rastafarian
Photo of Brick N' Mortar Kitchen & Catering - Heidelberg, PA, United States. Happy hippy salad with sweet onion vinaigrette dressing

gH5Pwh-xxoakso6drmukkw.text: First time today and I was not disappointed! Fun guy handheld was beyond delicious and the torts and corn mango salsa was to die for!  It's easy to see why the owner was encouraged to open a brick and mortar location.  Highly recommended!!

KTBSNvacpcx-VWiwanarYw.text: OK food bad "service"-We stopped at Brick n Mortar after walking past and thinking it looked interesting. The restaurant is small with only three tables and a bar. The waitress was standing there but did not greet us or acknowledge our presence. A fellow patron explained to us that you could sit wherever you wanted. We sat at the only available table and waited. After about five minutes we walked up to the bar area to realize that you placed your order at the counter. We placed our order and the waitress brought out our food. I ordered penne primavera, and the penne was overlooked. My husband ordered a sandwich plus a side of tots and a "snack" order of salsa from the "snack" portion of the menu. His sandwich and tots were decent, but the salsa was just a dish of salsa with no chips. He asked the waitress if he could have chips and she walked away. A man then came out with a small bowl of chips and told us that for future reference, you have to order chips separately but that he was giving them to us for free in case the menu was not clear. It felt a bit like an episode of curb your enthusiasm.  "How can I eat salsa without chips"?  At least give me a fork or spoon.  The waitress later came back to ask how the food was. I said that mine was ok and she walked away without asking any further question.

hGQ31Hg-OnddrDfRnHdrTw.text: The food here is fresh and good! Great salad dressing. Also great catering trays - they pay attention to detail with finishing touches such as freeh herbs and lemon slices!

Vx5zl4YXLKTrUhPC22nmSQ.text: First visit to the Burgh Bites Food Truck - was best lunch I have had in years!  Sandwich was huge and normally I don't finish a sandwich that big but I had to keep going because it was that delicious!  Side of their "torts" - tortillas added to my treat.  I will keep looking for this truck everywhere.  Is there such a thing as a food truck groupie??  If it's in your area, don't miss it!!

Qwyz4hZGEicFeSDot6EPvA.text: Every time I visit Brick N Mortar I am welcomed with a friendly "How have you been?". I've never been disappointed with their food. I've enjoyed their Friday Fish sandwich, Pizzas, and their salads. I've yet to be disappointed.

HL0Zzrcepq0m1IUKJYenRQ.text: Food flew out of the kitchen, ordered the loaded torts, they were excellent, and the Rastafarian. Meal was so good, and staff is friendly and polite.

hvQLwJZjoaiyppdlR8R5rQ.text: Food was good but nothing was right on my order. Paid for pepperoni on my pizza and chicken in my pasta and neither were present.

xObe5pXw3qtGC24OzvJCNQ.text: Placed a large order for myself and co-workers. Have eaten here a few times and really enjoyed the pulled pork in the past.   While waiting to check out, the staff was loudly complaining about our order, frustrated that we asked for a few items on the side & stuff like that. They obviously did not care that there were customers in the store, or that I was right there and able to hear the whole thing.  Our food came out looking pretty half assed, and clearly the worst of the times I've eaten here. Probably won't be returning or recommending it anymore.

S6NEARqgHvW1FVWDjuQ-Eg.text: Love the foot truck and now loveeeeee the restaurant!! Loaded torts are my fav!!! Always have to get them even when we already have order wayyyy too much food. The homemade chips and salsa on the loaded torts are to die for! Me and the hubby went bc they posted a picture of a Reuben. And I will say I'm a sucker for them. I am so happy we went for it. Not only did the Reuben actually look like the picture but it tastes 1000x better I could have even imaged! The homemade dressing was amazing. The meat literally melted in my mouth. My mouth is watering thinking about it now!   The place wasn't busy but my gosh do they do tons of take our orders. If I lived close by I would be ordering everyday! The staff is always so nice and helped us with ordering bc we couldn't make a decision and they even gave us a IC Light! It's the little things that mean so much now a days...  Also they pizzas are super good. We have the mushroom one and we have the guido. Both amazing. Takes longer to come out vs a sandwich but it's homemade so I can't be mad!!! Always fresh ingredients and such awesome people!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Brick N' Mortar Kitchen & Catering - Heidelberg, PA, United States. Reuben they had on special. Needs to be added to the menu!

fto0cZE6GMNJVF7rvCidkw.text: We ordered the harvest corn chowder and roasted tomato soup. They were so amazing I felt the need to yelp about it.  Absolutely the best soups I've ever had.

mhPXNFqfxcawTw8OEjpkgg.text: I have nothing but positive things to say about this place . Upon entering establishment I was greeted & asked if this was my first visit ' it was '  then the guy behind counter gave me some suggestions and told me to help myself to the complimentary wine or asked if I would like a Yuengling on draft that was also complimentary . I chose the god father burger & the pork & sauerkraut balls , both where awesome . Today in Pittsburgh we are spoiled with great places to eat & this place gets that & went out of their way to make me feel welcome so even if the food was average that would of made me come back but with this place the food & service are way above average so you can't go wrong . I can't wait to go back to try their Cuban sandwich & sample one of their pizza' s

g8BRSq6r1EdZAT7V_XxaZw.text: We had the Heidleberger and it was the best burger I have had in a long time!! Very friendly atmosphere.

72s4PeHCDthEPwVtE-NjDA.text: Brick n Mortar is all of you favorite Burgh's Bites Truck items available all the time plus pizza & more!!! The wife & I finally made the trek across the city to Heidelberg to get our fix. What I can say is the food may possibly be even better.  We love the combination of BBQ sauce on our Mushroom pizza, song with the garlic butter crust. So scrumptious!!  Also it is during lent and Brick n Mortar was offering a lent menu, so of course I tried the catfish po'boy, and I'm so happy I did. The crunch on the fried catfish was awesome, accompanied with pickled cucumbers and onions on a warm pita, I'm drooling thinking about it a day later.  The best thing the wife likes,  is of course her loaded torts, which are like nachos but with pita chips and an array pickled veggies, corn salsa?, cheese and choose of meat. She loved eating them in because they were so nice and fresh & FAST!!!  Now there are only two tables, and probably 12 chairs around the outside of the room. Don't expect to have a 5 course dinner, but I will tell you this place should be in the running for best overall food in Pittsburgh, grab a quick bite or take out.  Don't be like me, and wait to go. Get yourself down to Heidelberg, and thank me later!!

QvdlppAnxifcc4dm0SOS3g.text: First timer. Wasn't sure what to expect. We were a group of four; all had different dinners. Amazing food! Great service; will definitely return. Can't wait for the upstairs room to be complete!

84t0HxoLjXqNoYtFQWN51w.text: This establishment is small in interior but mammoth in quality. We ordered a brick pizza as an appetizer and man o man was it delicious. It's not your typical pizza with provolone and sauce, it's topped with cheese and Asiago with a nice hint of herb on top. We couldn't stop eating it but had to save room for dinner. The entree consisted of a giant breaded fish sammy on a very nice bun and I had the Asiago chicken. Both meals were perfect and I asked for a beer which wasn't quite chilled yet so instead they brought the customers out a complimentary can of chilled beer. What a perfect evening for us to try our newest favorite.

XLWyyBK1jEYR7egtd9kkQg.text: My wife and I found ourselves free from the kids on a Friday Night!  As we were discussing where to go, a friend told us about Brick & Mortar. Sounded Great! So we gave it a try-so glad we did!  It's small, but the food is awesome!  If you get a chance- check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Brick N' Mortar Kitchen & Catering - Heidelberg, PA, United States. Notorious P.I.G. From Brick &amp; Mortar!

1AFd5jm_qUggVdyYzg7gYw.text: We were looking for a non chain place for dinner. Checked out yelp and chose Brick n mortar kitchen for the positive reviews. The reviews were spot on. The food was fantastic, service was great. We had the sunshine salad and the Flankenstein handheld. Also an order of torts and corn salsa.  I usually have a take home box but I ate everything! It was that good!

Fidmi1mnaudD6Ih3x7WAMg.text: Went today for lunch. Incredible!!!!  Tuscan Tom pizza was perfect, couldn't decide what was tastier, cheese or crust.  Special chili today was pork and poblano peppers ...'mmmmmmmmmm. Amazing. Would recommend highly to anyone in Pittsburgh looking to maximum taste with minimum price!

l74UI1rdjkkUj-3cyOlepg.text: Posting this is making me hungry again.   As a matter of fact I've already asked to stop tomorrow.   We ordered from Grub Hub today, but it would be great to go in for a bite.  The food was awesome.    I had a beet salad with chicken, and my husband ordered a burger and a hot dog.   I see a lot more food from Brick N Mortar in our future.   It's a great addition to the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Brick N' Mortar Kitchen & Catering - Heidelberg, PA, United States
Photo of Brick N' Mortar Kitchen & Catering - Heidelberg, PA, United States

rIpSugzHVq-G60AsJClmfw.text: I had the Asia to chicken with fettuccini and it was fabulous.  Very generous portion with an attractive presentation.   My wife had the penne in mortar sauce.  She is a picky eater and she loved the dish.

KOQiAj5JFDw-3GdK_rTr2w.text: Stopped in yesterday (6/14) my Wife and I shared a bruschetta app and split a Guido and Hey Dude.  I am at a loss for words to describe how delicious everything was.  Amazing.  If you are searching for a gourmet sandwich your search is over.  We can't wait to try their pizza and everything else on their comprehensive menu.  Very friendly service and I can now hear them saying "Oh, it's them again"...

1RHwtkjdMdF_6Nh7X1gttQ.text: Saturday July 14th I went here to eat, it's very cute inside but there is limited space, however that didn't stop the staff from being lovely and accommodating for my friends and I, there were a total of 8 of us. They offered us the room upstairs which they are doing work on. It was nice & private and the service was amazing. The servers and cooks were very friendly and got us anything we had asked for. We really appreciated them making room for us to eat in the restaurant. The food was excellent. I personally had a pepperoni pizza. My friends had various wraps, salads and pasta. Highly recommend this to anyone who wants a delicious bite to eat. 12/10 would recommend. Thank you for your excellent service!

mYOXZBFyvw3_2-Ws5yfksw.text: My boyfriend and I tried this place out a couple weeks ago. DELICIOUS!!! The staff was friendly & helpful to us choosing our lunches. Everything looked outstanding. The place was small but clean and decorated with charm. Portions were BIG and prices more than reasonable! Will for sure be back. :)

bW09jUaPYv1kEFOs8YukjA.text: To make finding this place easier, look for B and M or Brick and Mortar. The Burgh Bites signage is less conspicuous. I ordered the Heidelburger, very good! My friend ordered the Hawaiian burger and also gave it a thumbs up. It took a little while to get our food but I think because it is made to order. They serve the burger with there own version of tortilla chips which were tasty. I recommend you get the corn salsa to go with it, very good! I would definitely return to explore other options on the menu.

eqjZcBwAkTZV5fMEOJ9eTg.text: Me and my girlfriend visited this restaurant for the first time today. It's a very beautiful place with real rustic hardwood tables. We tried the Garlique pizza and it was an amazing, fresh, thin crust pizza. And the real treat were the bacon wrapped hotdogs and thier unique sauerkraut that needed no extra toppings. The man working the front named John was very polite and friendly. Will definitely be back!

5hHjOpobCdCrsWLh9Y_HFg.text: Hands down a must try for anyone! They have a huge menu and I have never been disappointed! The restaurant is quaint and charming for sure! The classic rock makes it even more welcoming, for me at least. The staff is friendly and very helpful also. And the food is absolutely amazing. The Sandwiches are fresh and full of flavor, the burgers are hearty and fit for a king. The entrees are also 5 stars. I highly recommend this for anyone wanting to experience quality and a support a local small business!

photos.caption: Photo of Brick N' Mortar Kitchen & Catering - Heidelberg, PA, United States
Photo of Brick N' Mortar Kitchen & Catering - Heidelberg, PA, United States

UC-hbMvPp6XbVMCaP2HRjg.text: Tried something new and pleasantly surprised. We got the beet salad, loaded torts, and the Rastafarian handheld. Ordered it take out and it was ready on time. When we got home everything was still played neatly. Some places seem to just throw to-go food in a box and it is sloppy by the time it gets home. Food was delicious! This is now at the top of our list for take out.

C5z8DrBrPzJ9Q9VaxgybXg.text: Have been here quite a few times and the food is always delicious! Service is always nice, whether you pop in or call in an order. The menu is unique and executed perfectly! All items have SO much flavor and all the ingredients compliment each other nicely. You have to try it!

3YGX_zzy2sooFkgdqcx5nQ.text: Great food with amazing flavor variety and quality. We really enjoyed the chance to order from a great variety of ethnic influences. I will be walking away with a full stomach and a lingering smile on my face. Torts rock the tastebuds and they even have a good kids menu.

9AXnjXmIinncuceEaD-IEw.text: Burgh's Bites Food Truck is amazing. Their Brick n Mortar restaurant is equally as impressive. I don't think you could find a sub-par item if you tried. Great flavor, fresh ingredients, and lots of options. Even free beer (granted it's only due to them not having a liquor license yet)!!  Very small interior, I see it as more of a take-out place, or small party sit-down. We went for dinner on Saturday and luckily snatched up a table for 4. We had sandwiches, chips and salsa, and pizza between the group. Everything was delicious.  If I was in this neighborhood, I'd eat here every day. I'd get all my pizzas here. I'd get my lunches to-go daily. I'd order extra and have a late night snack. I'd save some in my fridge and eat it for breakfast. It's just that good.

hjEiUaBljt5cS70ACLYs4A.text: Very little chicken was given for a salad and it was also burnt. It wasn't a bad price just was so-so and def not something I'd order again, unfortunately.

l6wEQpsuZgbA19QYDXmz3Q.text: I have heard several good things about this place and thought I would give it a try! I ordered takeout for my husband and I on a weeknight. The woman who answered the phone was very pleasant and informative, helping me with my selection. The food was ready in the amount of time she had stated. The inside of the restaurant was very small, with only a few tables and high tops and a small TV (with the Pens game on). I ordered the Sunshine Salad with Sweet Onion Vinaigrette and the Guido Sandwich. The salad dressing was probably the best part of the salad! I wished there had been a fruit component or a meat on it but the salad was good as it was. The sandwich? Delicious! A unique combination of Italian flavors that worked well together. The cinnamon and sugar "Torts" were a wonderful addition to the meal.  Will I try this place again? Absolutely. I originally had trouble narrowing down what I wanted as there were a variety of options - sandwiches, pizzas, burgers, hot dogs (WHAT!), salads, entrees..  I will be back!

D5-J4-fKQXRto8jRitj1IQ.text: My new favorite restaurant in the area. Great for a quick lunch or pizza night. The staff is so warm and welcoming and always seem to be smiling.   I recently ordered the Rodeo pizza and pickle chips and absolutely loved each.

FGNp0vY8cYCyZUOsBeXW_g.text: The best Chicken Marsala I've ever had!!  Redneck Mac n Cheese was awesome as an appetizer coupled with the spicy Truck Pickles. It's a very small place but don't let that deter you - you will be very happy you stopped.

3ueJJI9lgTiNIMJaHrjLGw.text: The pizza pie here is excellent, and I have also enjoyed some of the sandwiches, along with tots and torts.  They have an interesting variety of drinks and also offer wine and local Insurrection beer on tap.  The dine-in area has room to seat 19 people, and is nicely decorated, The service has always been friendly, professional, and very courteous.  Awesome place!

photos.caption: Photo of Brick N' Mortar Kitchen & Catering - Heidelberg, PA, United States. The basil that topped my pizza was grown fresh right outside the restaurant door . . .
Photo of Brick N' Mortar Kitchen & Catering - Heidelberg, PA, United States
Photo of Brick N' Mortar Kitchen & Catering - Heidelberg, PA, United States. 14&#34; Brick n&#39; Mortar pizza to-go . . .

Tf4uYy2Y56JsaDB61yqAaQ.text: I've had the pleasure of having dinner here twice now! The first time I got a burger, I can't remember the exact name, but it had gardenia mix on it and let me tell you IT WAS SO GOOD!!   When I returned with a group of 9 ladies we got to sit in their private room upstairs. We all sampled different pizzas and salads and honestly loved them all. We also fought over their tortilla chips and salsa. You're really missing out if you do not start your meal with it!!  My favorites of the night were probably the Pizza with the BBQ sauce and the anti hippie salad!   I can't wait to go back!

UHC6fNVH-Iym3aXoIyTYvw.text: So i went there for lunch the other day and i was truly overwhelmed. As soon as i walked in I was really digging the ambiance and vibes throughout the place. The menu was ginourmous and a little overwhelming, It took me a few minutes to truly tackle it and have any sort of idea what i actually wanted because everything honestly sounds so good. I finally decided on the Rastafarian and it was sensational, every bite was a flavor blast, the chicken was tender and juicy and the mango corn salsa was to die for. Not to mention the tater tots a dish that is so simple and easy to make yet most people actually mess up, not here they did not skip a beat on a single portion of this meal.

uDpOfPzzBJur-yC39jRs3g.text: Got the Brick N' Mortar Burger and Pedro Dog. Both we excellent. The food was very good and the topping on both had a homemade taste to it. Very fresh. The Tortilla chips were addictive.

8XgC27G_fkUz_AjM0VMUww.text: cool spot with a friendly staff and good food.  More importantly the prices are fair.  Had a very good chipotle pork shoulder sandwich.

gLIeTiQWC8RFEmuMxEylMw.text: One of my top 5 favorite food spots. Highly recommend this unsuspecting spot.   I've tried something from every part of this menu. It's almost unbelievable, but you cannot go wrong with any option. It's almost like everything on the menu is the best I've had, even the pizza has amazing flavor.   Highly recommended the guido sandwich, buffalo chicken pizza and loaded tots!

R0UM8rIajYTyabyZIsc4sg.text: Delicious. Ordered takeout- staff was very friendly on the phone and in person, and the atmosphere when picking food up was warm and cozy. We got an order of fried pickles, the brick n mortar burger & the Rastafarian handheld. Everything was great- wouldn't change a thing (except now I'm craving more tortes and already inhaled all of mine. SO GOOD. Order extra!) We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Brick N' Mortar Kitchen & Catering - Heidelberg, PA, United States. Rastafarian Handheld
Photo of Brick N' Mortar Kitchen & Catering - Heidelberg, PA, United States. Brick and Mortar Burger
Photo of Brick N' Mortar Kitchen & Catering - Heidelberg, PA, United States. Fried pickles

PoFrZbepJRH7hIu2r_fNhw.text: My friends and I always love trying out new restaurants when we get the chance. I looked this place up, after finding great reviews about it. It was my friends birthday and while we were there, I went up to the counter to ask if they do anything special for birthdays. They said they haven't done anything in the past, but "we'll figure it out". 3 of their employees came out with a boom box and a little dessert! It definitely made our night. The food was awesome (I had the Cuban) and they were great at thinking on the spot! Thanks guys!

LM2TlzB3VYI9ltJN3pleuw.text: Loved every minute of our time at Brick N' Mortar! Staff and prices are amazing! Thanks! We'll be back!

Hb7EseeH6s3VXehTzQ8uPw.text: Had the pleasure of having dinner with my bestie just last evening and I'm already planning to go back for lunch today with my husband! Their mushroom soup and salads are to die for!!! My friend also had the tomato soup as well as the beet salad and she really enjoyed! I most definitely recommend 1000%

VAIGOoofC7oGo2fNCssHPg.text: This has quickly become my family's go-to takeout place. The food is delicious and the staff is super friendly. We've yet to order something that we didn't like.

vaoxvowplkOn5JN37Zuhuw.text: What a great spot! I ended up getting the brick and mortar salad!! How delish! I was trying not to make a pig of myself. I am glad that I succeeded in this lol. The salad was a great choice and getting the chance to try some local food!   The salad was delicious it came with bacon. Cheese, egg and I added some of their grilled chicken. The croutons are out of this world delicious. My daughter got a bacon wrapped hotdog and gave me the thumbs up with a smile so she enjoyed them. My husband landed on the Cuban sandwich.   They are expanding, and did I mention they gave us free alcohol! Talk about winning! The lady at the front was extremely patient and recommended things like sweet onion dressing I got! I may end up back here again before we leave! And apparently they deliver!!!

gOHuiABiHiuQH1RrgRJLGg.text: The food here is fresh and tasty. I frequent it often for work lunch.  In addition to coming out quickly, it just tastes healthy and fresh. I love the corn salsa and jerk chicken. The coleslaw is also quite good. Everything is just different enough to be interesting.  I look forward to coming sometime with the family. There is something for everyone.  The only downside is the cramped atmosphere with few tables and very narrow counter seating along the walls. There is barely enough room for your knees. I find the counter to be uncomfortable but usually end up sitting so that a party of one does not take up a table. Despite the less-than-ideal seating, I keep coming back.

qWJjLxX4wjfpwqHYnU5Jjw.text: This place is awesome! So much to choose from, try the Pasta Asiago with chicken and it was delicious. Can't wait to go back and try something new.   The flankenstein is amazing. New favorite place! The

0SI9yJJ79AQDvPTY00Azdg.text: Great burgers.  We have been there twice and both time enjoyed the burgers.  Be prepared to enjoy a lot of meat on your burger.  There are not a lot of places to sit but we enjoyed the outdoor space.

3BWz04mOe1Yduc_2eqonjQ.text: Place is exceptional...I just had to rate it... Will be back to further expound on my experiences

vCanurRT8Wwrvhu1fqOSZw.text: Roasted Tomato Soup = delicious  Truck Pickles = savory & just enough spice & perfect addition to a burger Pork and Kraut Balls = delicious Heidelberger  = delicious, cooked just right

dDgKPyy1wOZQvizN5NQbEw.text: Absolutely fantastic, this place looks small (and it is) but it packs HUGE incredible flavor and ambiance, that staff were very friendly, serve time was about 20ish minutes which is about average for a sit down restaurant, but when the food came I swear my eyes grew twice the size, it looked absolutely amazing!  10/10 I will absolutely be coming back here again and again, I don't think you could find a bad item on the menu.

0SSTbB6B3yLmajVQB1TSRQ.text: Great food at extremely reasonable prices. Service was fast and friendly and the atmosphere was very pleasant. We will definitely be back.

sXdjurQEPPHTh0MRH596Hg.text: The Asiago chicken and pasta is most favorite meal out of any pasta and chicken dish anywhere. We came here for my birthday this year. The Asiago chicken is like nothing else I have had before. It's amazing!

pJFAo27ro2UiRtkw1Z_afg.text: Friendly people and simple recipes elevate this hidden gem of Heidelberg. Daily specials accompany an enthusiastic menu of sandwiches (served on pita or on ciabatta), burgers, dogs, pizzas, salads, and sides. Most orders come with a side of freshly seasoned pita chips, which are addicting enough to warrant an order on their own. Free flavored water and cheap glass bottles of pop add the extra effort of care from a restaurant that's already got a good thing going.  My favorites are the sandwiches on pita, or just about anything that has a sauce on it. A lot of the sauce-less sandwiches, though they have things like pickles or coleslaw, are still a bit dry especially when served on the thick and airy ciabatta. The portions are perfect and I've yet to show up and order something I didn't enjoy--though I'm a sucker for finding my favorites and sticking with them (Rastafarian, Flankenstein, Olympian, Fun Guy).  There isn't a lot of seating, but in the summer, there's a nice outdoor area. I haven't tried their food cart, but I'll be sure to check it out the next time I see them!

9a86Ag4N85FO6aaKZIRZLQ.text: I highly recommend this place! We had a small Christmas party upstairs...perfect room just for a small gathering...the owner was fabulous, the service was excellent! Personally the Tuscan Tom pizza was to die for and i couldn't get enough of the loaded torts

eNr7X0zhUpApgoesrXLQiA.text: We have gotten take out from here several times now. So far, everything is delicious! Fried pickle chips are fantastic! The Sunday Sauce will spoil you! Soooo good! We have also gotten a few handhelds. Seriously, we haven't been disappointed and neither will you!

KT90cL9SRD6gd-k-bukDZA.text: Tiny local spot. 4 maybe 5 tables. Do not order the falafel, you will be disappointed. My sisters had soup and salad which they liked. Not suitable for vegans or vegetarians

tc_kEpKTdCQfrD5NmtZUOQ.text: This place amazes me.   I had some friends over and we decided to order delivery.    I ordered a couple of burgers, Loaded Tots, and a Pizza.  All were phenomenal.    A high recommend :)

t-k4q4ogFwnUQDJxatWc9g.text: Great food ! Our first visit tonight after reading positive reviews on Yelp Do not be dismayed by the small size of the restaurant and if you prefer get your order "to go " There are only two tables inside and one outside however there are counter seats . The staff is very nice and the pasta we had was excellent! My Grandfather immigrated from Italy and I  grew up in NYC so feel like I am a good judge of Pasta The Burgers and pizza looked excellent also !    5 stars !

_FKHbIbYFF0lRUnM8PB7rw.text: Kicking myself for not trying this place sooner! Awesome food, good looking menu with variety, very friendly staff. We were in the mood for burgers so we tried the Brick n Mortar burger and the Heidelberger, both were great (but the side of tots were super salty). We ate in the dining area, as others have pointed out it's small but it looks like there's an outside area for when it gets warmer. We will return!

ezbsfCfSGyraM2fzKDrcbA.text: I've ordered delivery from Brick N' Mortar several times while visiting my friends that live nearby. Their food is great. So far, I've tried the Rastafarian Handheld, the Flankenstein Handheld, the Kickin' Cuban Handheld, the Fun Guy Handheld, and the Poulter Guy Handheld. All of them have been delicious. I also really love the side of "torts" that come with the handhelds. A lot of take out food is heavy and unhealthy, but I like that I can get a healthier meal with fresh veggies and high quality ingredients from Brick N' Mortar. They have become one of my go-to's for delivery on the weekends.

eIwBcPVfsvVheZZn6XAy_Q.text: Ok so I haven't had then in awhile and people kept telling me the food wasn't good but I tried again anyway. Well I ordered the same dish as last time the chicken Asiago. Very disappointed! They forgot a key ingredient the sun dried tomatoes. This time it had very few peppers and they were mushy. Also last time I had this dish the chicken was so tender I didn't even need a knife not so much this time it is a little over cooked. Whoever made this didn't do a good job. I don't think I will order again.

WB7OapDUXCyA2QBRPLIu8g.text: I have kind of mixed feelings about this place. The staff was absolutely wonderful. The food was pretty good and they were great getting the kid's pasta out quickly for my daughter. But this place is tiny. There are only two tables that a smaller kid could sit at, and a couple of counter height bar type tables along the walls. Its definitely great for a lunch joint but probably won't really be able to come back for a family dinner. They're pretty prevalent on the delivery sites so that's more likely for us in the future.

0zZy7zrFf7g41D8mcjGvwg.text: This is a great addition to the Heidelberg area!! All the food I've tried (burgers, tots, hot dogs, salads, pizza) have all been delicious and consistent. I think it's better to take out as they have a very tiny seating area that gets very crowded on a busy night. The staff is very friendly and accommodating every time I've been there or called. Definitely a hidden gem to check out!!

PI7xajj6N73vUVW1nIw42w.text: Amazing food and even more amazing service!  We will definitely be back. What a find! The wait staff accommodated our after soccer party of 15 with ease and a smile. What a refreshing experience.     I had the Rastafarian wrap- Jamaican Jerk Chicken with a corn mango salsa.  Full of flavor! My husband had the Kickin' Cuban Sandwich.  The menu is fun and has a great variety of salads, pizza, wraps, tots, entrees, etc.  This place is worth a visit.

2rROWVNkmHtYQSwz021_bA.text: I just got Brick N Mortar last night on a whim, and let me tell you, it was fantastic. I was in the mood for pizza, and the Tom Tomato did not disappoint. Also, the cheesy breadsticks with the mortar sauce earned rave reviews from my gf. Minor issue is the tots were incredibly salty, but I got them with garlic aioli so that balanced it a bit.  The only reason I gave 4/5 is simply due to options. Yes, they have entrees like hot dogs, pizza, and pasta, but gf is vegan and we found incredibly limited options, though that is kinda typical. We were able to get her the bruschetta with pita, which she enjoyed, but it was one of only 2 or 3 things she could have.   Overall, really enjoyed this and would order again in a heartbeat. If they could expand vegan/vegetarian options that would be great but even if they don't, I'll eat here/order from here again!

zPYJOKb3HErDR95wBA32fg.text: Brick n mortar burger with a side of tots. 1/2 lb all beef burger cooked to order  topped w/brick cheese (cheddar?) truck pickles, greens, tomato, pickled red onion, housemade chipotle catsup and roasted garlic/horsey aioli on a brioche bun.   The burger was cooked perfectly and seasoned ok, but could use more salt/pepper. The pickled onions were tangy if you got one by itself, but like the pickles(pickled cucs), didn't bring much taste (maybe need more?). The chipotle catsup was amazing. It was so much better than regular catsup because of the mild (my wife would say medium) heat. I would put this on everything!  The brioche bun held up to the juicy burger right to the end.   This was an excellent burger and tots make everything better. Next time I'm out here, I'll def come back.   Burger, tots, water bottle plus 20% tip $17.30. Decent price for such good quality. Some might say pricey, but I'll pay for excellent food.

photos.caption: Photo of Brick N' Mortar Kitchen & Catering - Heidelberg, PA, United States. Burger, tots, water bottle plus 20% tip $17.30. Decent price for such good quality. Some might say pricey, but I&#39;ll pay for excellent food.
Photo of Brick N' Mortar Kitchen & Catering - Heidelberg, PA, United States. Brick-N-Mortar Burger &amp; Side of Tots
Photo of Brick N' Mortar Kitchen & Catering - Heidelberg, PA, United States. Menu

F3xaKlXf3DAA-JKL4dOr7Q.text: We tried this place for the first time. The food was fantastic. My wife had pizza and says it's the best pizza she ever eaten. From the crust to the toppings all perfection. I had a sandwich and again it's was the best. The sandwich toppings were fresh and perfectly assembled. We will be back again.

RgG3Ww1Po2B67fsWfqaRvQ.text: Located on 50, or Washington Pike, or Railroad St, or whatever variation of "the main road that goes through Heidelberg" you'll find Brick N' Mortar, the...well...brick and mortar location of the Burgh Bites food truck.    When I stopped in yesterday, my girlfriend and I decided to split some items. Their Penne (with vodka sauce), the Sunshine salad, and falafel. Of note-the restaurant is BYOB so we brought our own bottle of Finger Lakes wine (shameless drop of my favorite wine area), but they do have one tap it seems of beer from their neighbor, Insurrection Brewing.   First food out was the falafel. 4 2 to 2.5" disks of very tasty falafel. It was a little on the crumbly side, but whatever. That's what forks are for. Next came the salad and pasta. The vodka sauce was wonderful. Creamy with just a hint of that vodka flavor with noodles that were how I like them. The portion was also huge. We split our fair share but still brought some home. A great deal for the price. Salad wise it was just as large as the pasta, and we got two dressings to try - a mustard vinaigrette and their balsamic vinaigrette. I just went mustard while there, which was a wonderful addition I would get again and the balsamic is waiting for me to have with the remainder of salad for lunch.   I suppose my one limited gripe would be rather uncomfortable seats. It's not a large space, good for take out for sure, but if you do eat there you won't be leaning back much. I noticed they had a small outdoor seating area I'd love to try when it's not cool and rainy out, maybe once spring rolls back around!

jIGPlo-FqjPlZOPh6Yknkw.text: My son and I found this place while in town with or phellow Phillies fans that invaded the city and apparently every Primanti Bros. Restaurant in town. We were driving around and found this place not far from our hotel. I only wish we had time to go back a second time because it was delicious. I had the Cuban sandwich and my son a delicious hamburger.  I don't know when I will be in Pittsburgh again but if I am I will be stopping again.

ZANgjg28vCV4o7iDGsHeIQ.text: This is a very tasty eatery in heidelberg near bridegville. There is a small outdoor patio and small indoor seating area.  They have a variety of items from sandwiches, burgers, pizzas, soup etc., etc, etc., THEY ALSO offer free beer and wine for sit down guests.  We had the Creamy Marsala Mushroom Soup, which was very good and the Flankenstein sandwich which was descent, I didn't like the cilantro and thought it needed a sauce.  We also had the pedro hot dog with mango salsa and chips which was excellent and the Tuscan Tom pizza which was good but I wanted it to be more of a WOW!  I like the food here and will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Brick N' Mortar Kitchen & Catering - Heidelberg, PA, United States. Mushroom Marsala soup
Photo of Brick N' Mortar Kitchen & Catering - Heidelberg, PA, United States. Tuscan Tom
Photo of Brick N' Mortar Kitchen & Catering - Heidelberg, PA, United States. Pedro hot dog

0YIuNfgSvXV898OMIlqZvQ.text: Have been to BnM a couple of times since my last review.  There is a special Lent menu.   Have had a couple of the pizza specials and really have enjoyed those.   Most recently just ordered a couple of burgers for take out with my kid.  I ordered The Godfather but my kid ended up taking it so I had the Notorious PIG that he ordered.  Anyway, I really enjoyed the burger even thou I would not have originally ordered.  Surprised at how good and juicy the burger was with some chipotle braised pork shoulder, crispy bacon, cheddar jack cheese and truck pickles.   Some of the items on this menu are just a mouthful of flavor and the food is well prepared.  Now I am looking to try the Lent menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Brick N' Mortar Kitchen & Catering - Heidelberg, PA, United States. 2019 Lent Menu specials

wFrxYsENzr60AXQgnf5OOw.text: Great food! Love the Olympian sandwich and Brick n' Mortar salad. So nice to see unique flavor combinations and quality ingredients. Please bring your food truck to Burns White parking lot in the Strip District (48 26th Street). Hungry lawyers and tech workers will thank you!

A34JKtBD5lQ5D9W2Yjiuow.text: I'm a creature of habit and enjoy going to the same restaurant, bar and stores whenever possible. I just moved to Pittsburgh and was craving pizza. Brick N' Mortar is everything you need in your local Pizza/Burger joint. It has a great atmosphere, broad/creative menu and most importantly pizza that'll light your tastebuds up. 10 out of 10 people would recommend.

kgqcDfOCqJLM89_-6H57mA.text: This place is AMAZING!! This was my first time time eating here and I can say beyond certainty, I! WILL! BE! BACK! Yes, even in my Arnold Swazenagger voice. Absolutely DELICIOUS!!

DXO_iLxF7E3o1FiQBE-F2A.text: I love it here.  salad w fresh greens and beets and grilled chicken breast is amazing.  Small place.  BYOB. Order at counter. Always nice help all 10 visits so doing something right people-wise.

lyKCDzufTlfd8FDbmxtE5Q.text: SO. FREAKING. GOOD. One of my local favorites, this place never disappoints! Great, unusual menu, and something new to try every time. Had the Falafelicious Handheld. Amazing! The pickled onions and cucumber sauce make this sooooo good! Torts with a side of mango salsa is a must. If you haven't stopped in, do yourself a favor, and try it soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Brick N' Mortar Kitchen & Catering - Heidelberg, PA, United States. Falafelicious Handheld with torts and mango salsa

hm2jZjidC7LmJWNmFLU2kw.text: I'm doing a hypnosis show in Pittsburgh and stumbled upon this little gem.  Big, healthy salads and crispy homemade tots! Complimentary wine and great music coming out of the speakers.  Friendly staff too!

photos.caption: Photo of Brick N' Mortar Kitchen & Catering - Heidelberg, PA, United States

DQ5koDdlEi4X7XIzMXyY1A.text: I had a great experience at Brick N Mortar with my girlfriends! We had a large party and there wasn't much room for us. We were ready to place our order to go when the staff made accommodations for us upstairs! It was very appreciated and the entire staff was very nice, checking in on us periodically. I had the Olympian, which was a delicious Greek wrap! Their tortilla chips are the perfect combination of salty and a little bit sweet! Perfectly paired with the mango corn salsa! The friendly staff & delicious food makes me want to come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Brick N' Mortar Kitchen & Catering - Heidelberg, PA, United States. Olympian Handheld with Torts
Photo of Brick N' Mortar Kitchen & Catering - Heidelberg, PA, United States
Photo of Brick N' Mortar Kitchen & Catering - Heidelberg, PA, United States. Torts with Corn and Mango Salsa

mRQGJp_pJwFRn2fFPnqFJg.text: Always outstanding! Tried the Reuben special and it was likely the best I've ever had. We always order the loaded tots with veggies and they never disappoint. Keep doing what your doing. This place consistently serves up some of the freshest best food I've had from a restaurant!

Uf81whyg4Km_j2qjwsuk-A.text: This is my new favorite takeout spot. I'm obsessed the sandwiches. The ingredients are all fresh and all so unique. The menu has something to offer everyone and there are so many great sauces to try. I also am a huge fan of the seasoned pita chips. I highly recommend giving this place a try.

peh27fQTKfEFBg_SCdoq-w.text: Tiny tiny place. Not many options for seating.   We got the tater tots and salads. I wasn't overly impressed with either. Even though my lunch mate raced about them previously.   Service was friendly!

-xLtHnfAmEUEprBt6HKlIw.text: I had an awesome Cuban sandwich, my wife had a grilled chicken salad and the kids had the bacon wrapped hotdog. All of our food was exceptional, proceed below what I thought the food was worth and did I mention you get a free glass of wine or beer and you can BYOB.   I believe they are expanding upstairs to provide more seating. Parking is a bit of a hassle but don't let it deter you from trying it out. They also deliver.

GAKsn81wCOB6V-XADRObag.text: Wow. This tiny place (and I mean there's like 20 seats) was phenomenal. We came Saturday morning but got lunch. Both of us had sandwiches which were amazing, and we sat in the very cute window seat. Everyone was very nice and no one laughed when I didn't know what "torts" were (they're homemade tortillas which are delicious!). Would recommend to DDD!

RHPoi_1NDZoKaRI1vVI0gw.text: Ricci catered my husband's birthday last year and everyone raved about the food. We were super excited to hear about Brick N Mortar opening! Finally had a chance to visit this weekend and am happy to report that the food remains just as phenomenal as the first time we had it. We will be back...often!

KihSv24f--CztbTVbf1i0g.text: We came in close to closing -- but everyone was friendly and had a great attitude. Pizza was fantastic.  Complimentary beer.

IqZieUPUB0jiAcv-H2WgCA.text: Typically too lazy to write reviews, but this place deserves it! Don't be skeptical because of the number of reviews.  This place is awesome with super fresh ingredients! Get the Rastafarian. The jerk chicken was seasoned properly and was juicy and the pita was soft and fresh. The tortilla chips that come with the sandwiches are top notch..dusted with sugar and spices. Get the corn mango salsa with the chips. It's the way to go!

S-mbjxHg3xsMHxgFV_CwXQ.text: Pizza awesome.  Small place, but good music on in the background.  Carry insurrection on tap.  Will be back

EwAE2Lir8YGk5nE36dSJLA.text: I really love the food at this casual spot.  This is the best place to eat in Heidelberg.  The pizza is authentic and the sandwiches, hoagies, and burgers are great too!

2B40vXDuOAAGdBwgqCQyyA.text: Ordered delivery and it was fast and delicious. Best take out I've had in a long time
